aws::graph::propositions: Competition and Technology Challenges for Amazon
New and enhanced technologies increase competition for Amazon.
Search technologies increase competition for Amazon.
Web computing services increase competition for Amazon.
Infrastructure computing services increase competition for Amazon.
Practical applications of artificial intelligence increase competition for Amazon.
Practical applications of machine learning increase competition for Amazon.
Digital content increases competition for Amazon.
Satellites increase competition for Amazon.
Electronic devices increase competition for Amazon.
The internet facilitates competitive entry against Amazon.
The internet facilitates comparison shopping.
Comparison shopping enhances the ability of new businesses to compete against Amazon.
Comparison shopping enhances the ability of smaller businesses to compete against Amazon.
Comparison shopping enhances the ability of lesser known businesses to compete against Amazon.
Amazon's product offerings may not be successful due to competition.
Amazon's service offerings may not be successful due to competition.
Amazon may fail to gain business due to competition.
Amazon may lose business due to competition.
Amazon may be required to increase spending due to competition.
Amazon may be required to lower prices due to competition.
Increased spending could materially reduce Amazon's sales.
Increased spending could materially reduce Amazon's profits.
Lower prices could materially reduce Amazon's sales.
Lower prices could materially reduce Amazon's profits.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/
/FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/

text: In addition, new and enhanced technologies, including search, web and infrastructure computing services, practical applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning, digital content, satellites, and electronic devices continue to increase our competition. The internet facilitates competitive entry and comparison shopping, which enhances the ability of new, smaller, or lesser known businesses to compete against us. As a result of competition, our product and service offerings may not be successful, we may fail to gain or may lose business, and we may be required to increase our spending or lower prices, any of which could materially reduce our sales and profits.
